intro: Barleria arnottiana var. pentandra, commonly known as the purple barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its showy flowers, which are typically purple or blue, are borne in clusters at the leaf axils. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas.
